page.title: 18Sewage Treatment Works.
page.content: On average each of us uses{40 gall. {of water daily,}the Works takes this and rainwater. The sewage is first{minced}by machine and then flows into a 7m deep {settling tank,}here the sludge sinks to the bottom and the water overflows into a{tank}where it collects until there is enough to slowly turn the 4 tubular arms of the sprinkler spraying water onto the angular stones of the circular{bacteria bed}beneath. The{sludge}rots for use as {fertilizer. The bacteria feed on the organisms still living in the water,which is now allowed into another settling tank,and the{purified water}joins the River Severn. Untreated waste put in the river would mean the{death of plants and {fish, and the risk of disease.
